result.execSummary:
The defendant James Hammond Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay costs and surcharge.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Restitution is set at $0.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
** 12-11-15/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner**
The defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 60 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC



Stayed pending a review on 12-11-15 1:15 pm.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Hammond Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-11-15 Court order imposing 60 days of condition time.

Defendant James Hammond not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant fails to appear.Defendant ordered to serve 60 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant James Hammond in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  The state has been contacted by the victim who wishes to have contact with the defendant.
Statements to the court.    Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 39 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-15 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay costs and surcharge.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at $0.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called and the defendant is not present.  Defense counsel explains that he (Atty Renden) has been on vacation for a week and has received several voice mails from the defendant.  Counsel requests that the court stay a bench warrant to next week to allow him to contact defendant.  The court will stay a BW to 8-25-2015 at 8:15.
NOTE:  After counsel left the courtroom defendant appeared with his sister.  Bailiff have court slip with next date and admonished defendant to appear on time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.
with all previous conditions continued.   mld
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Cout.   mld

Defendant James Hammond in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant James Hammond in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin 
with Micha Schwab (under the student practice rule).
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-20-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant James Hammond not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Based on defendant not being produced, Plea and Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to Branch 4 on 7-22-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case is currently scheduled for a Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-22-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
with all previous conditions continued.  mld

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant James Hammond not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waived the appearance of defendant, upon teh request of defense counsel.  Defense motion to modify bail is heard and granted by the court.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial was entered by defense on 6-2-2015.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-22-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Speedy trial demand entered this date

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Peggy H

Defendant James Hammond in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant James Hammond in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court ordered 2nd last paragraph amended to reflect correct date of June 24, 2014.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
